clinical_study.brief_title: Primary Anatomical Versus Primary Electrophysiological Approach in Circumferential Pulmonary Vein Ablation
clinical_study.official_title: Circumferential Pulmonary Vein Ablation in Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation: Randomized Comparison Between a Primary Anatomical Versus a Primary Electrophysiological Approach

brief_summary.textblock: Randomized comparison between 2 techniques of circumferential pulmonary vein ablation in paroxysmal atrial fibrillation: Primary anatomical ablation with secondary closure of possible electrical gaps versus primary electrophysiological ablation at the sites of atrio-venous electrical breakthroughs with secondary circumferential ablation around the pulmonary vein orifice

primary_outcome.measure: Freedom from atrial tachyarrhythmias at 6-months follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison of procedural characteristics (duration, fluoroscopy time, ablation time, ablation energy, complications)

intervention.description: primary ablation of atrio-venous breakthrough sites followed by circumferential ablation around pulmonary vein orifice
primary circumferential ablation around the pulmonary vein orifice followed by ablation of possible conduction gaps

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- paroxysmal atrial fibrillation
- age over 18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- persistent atrial fibrillation
- reversible cause of atrial fibrillation
- inability to comply with follow-up
